pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:5.1: 34. The training rule on an even measure of bean curry
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating large amounts of bean curry with their almsfood. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:7.2: “‘I will eat almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:8.2: there are two kinds of bean curry:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:8.3: mung-bean and black-gram curry, to be taken with the hand.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:8.4: Almsfood should be eaten with the right proportion of bean curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:8.5: If a monk out of disrespect eats much bean curry, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:9.12: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:10.1: The fourth training rule is finished.
